trs: Peter remembered the word of the Lord.’ %(Luke 22:61)
You visited me’ (lit.\,‘you found my report’). %(Matthew 25:36)
The Lord rejected them.’ %(Shenoute, cited in \citealt[34]{Shisha-Halevy1988Coptic})
The demons knew the Lord.’  %(Shenoute, cited in \citealt[35]{Shisha-Halevy1988Coptic})
The bad ones, he cast them out.’  %(Matthew 13:48, cited in \citealt{Layton2004Coptic}: 132)
And he threw him down.’  %(Luke 4:35, cited in \citealt{Layton2004Coptic}: 132)
He casts out demons by means of Beelzebul.’  %(Luke 11:15, cited in \citealt[132]{Layton2004Coptic})
He cast out a demon.’ %(Luke 11:14, cited in \citealt[132]{Layton2004Coptic})
You cast it out.’ %(Acts 13:46, cited in \citealt{Layton2004Coptic})
And let us agree.’ (lit.\,‘let us establish our hand’) %(Besa 3:30)
And let us agree’ (lit.\,‘let us establish our hand’). %(Besa 3:30)
He did not leave another thing.
No one puts new wine into old wineskins.’  %(Mark 2:22, cited in \citealt[132]{Layton2004Coptic})
They did not love the blessing, and it fled away from them.
Let us remember those things that our father has said’ (lit.\, ‘Let us do the thought of the things that our father has said’).
to forget the commandments of God’ (lit.\,`to do the forgetting of the commandments of God')
As for hospitality, do not forget it.’  %(Hebrews 13:2, cited in \citealt{Layton2004Coptic}:142)
Let us remember those things that our father has said’ (lit.\,‘Let us do the remembrance of those things that our father has said’).
Let us remember those things that our father has said.
You have copper’ (lit.\,‘there is copper in your hand’).  %(Late Ramesside Letters 19:15)
Does he have a Syrian crew?
As for foxes, they have their holes.
Does the servant have any thanks?

src: ount-f-eksousia mmau nci-p-šêre m-p-rôme e-ka-nobe ebol
trs: The son of man has authority to forgive sins.
